Screenplays are so technical you shouldn't try to 'work out' the story in a script, do it in prose first. #mindshift @IrishWritersCtr
You should not be writing for yourself, you're writing for an audience, put them first. Write stories that matter, not just 4 entertainment.
If someone makes you an offer which is more than what you imagined, count to 5 and say 'I really was hoping for more than that!' #mindshift
Floor figure is 20K, ceiling is around three times that, though writers guilds think it should be 2% flat even if film goes on to make 2m.
Being prepared to say 'no' is a very powerful position as a negotiator, if a producer cannot give you a figure, don't take them seriously.
When your script is optioned don't get bogged down in the minutiae, if it doesn't succeed, you get rights back. #mindshift @IrishWritersCtr
We teach the wrong people wrong things in the wrong ways, don't bother with Uni courses, get job in the industry. #julienfriedman #mindshift
People with creative dominant right brains cannot pull apart structure well, left brains can. You need both to be a scriptwriter. #mindshift
Phenylethylamine (PEA) is released in the body when you watch a good film, same as during sex. #strangeinfo #mindshift @IrishWritersCtr
Four quadrons: young/old/male/female - your script has to appeal to all four, this is what you have to 'prove' to investors. #mindshift
It's a much more competitive industry than say, writing novels. Costs a lot more. Why do more men succeed in this genre? #mindshift #agent
Read two scripts a week and at least 100 in total before you ever try to be a scriptwriter @IrishWritersCtr #julienfriedman #mindshift
Screenplays are a very specific way of writing, far too much emphasis on formatting and less on how to tell a good story. #julienfriendman
What happens if the publisher retains film rights to your fictional work? Julien Friedman suggests writers try to keep those rights.
Not enough women are applying for grants and loans to write feature films [in UK] therefore even fewer are making progress. #mindshift
London-based agent Julian Friedmann next up here @IrishWritersCtr #mindshift (He's Joe O'Connor's agent). Talking novels to screen.
Never be put off approaching people/family/source material even if you don't have dosh, people appreciate their story being told #mindshift
Juanita Wilson, author of Winter's Bone giving a fascinating talk here @IrishWritersCtr #mindshift on adapting a story for screen.
Action is really important, but emotional truth is what you buy into when it comes to adapting story for screen #mindshift @IrishWritersCtr
If you feel strongly about the story 'events' will help you work through it, but the emotional logic is just as important #mindshift #screen
Within material you'll find structures/sequences that fall naturally into order, opposite to how it's taught. #mindshift @IrishWritersCtr
The difficult part is getting from that awful first unwieldy document (180 page) to whittle down to screenplay with good pacing. #Mindshift
You can never fully describe while writing for screen like you can with fiction. Plot is very important, enough action to pull you through.
Certain things lend themselves to screen better than others, adaptations in segments of 30mins/60/30. Points of change, moments of shift.
It's about funding and hidden biases, how things are judged & what stories are deemed important and marketable. #MindShift @IrishWritersCtr
Battling unconscious bias (Dr. Susan Liddy) Patronised, overly anaysed, a sense of dismissiveness of women's stories. #MindShift
Only 13% women of Irish or Irish-based writers attached to 'produced live action' indigenous feature films between 1993-2003. #mindshift
Dr. Susan Liddy up next here at #mindshift
Gender has always been an issue for me, how I programme @IrishWritersCtr says @bielva, there is a serious need for set policies. #mindshift
Every woman who wants to write (film/tv) should be able to write what they want to write but what makes it 'commercially viable'? #MindShift
...considered important. It's about ten times 'harder' for women and the stats confirm this. #MindShift @IrishWritersCtr
Marian Quinn started off in acting, got frustrated, started to write, made a short film (32A). A film about 4 X 13 yr old girls wasn't...
